DataElement.preferredName: Stratification Criterion Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Foci Date and Time Range ISO21090.IVL.TS.DATETIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity defined at a global library level that identifies pre-treatment factors by which study subjects are segregated to assure balance of these factors before randomization to a study arm or some smaller segment of a study. The decisive factor used to help segregate the study subject into a stratum group. The time period in which the observation result is held to be true, expressed either as a simple date range or as an evaluable expression that references a study-defined date or milestone. EXAMPLE(S): For a survey question, "Have you traveled to Europe between 1990 and 1999?", the focalDateRange would be "January 1, 1990 to December 31, 1999". For the question, "Have you smoked in the last 2 months", the focalDateRange would be an expression referencing a variable that represents the PerformedObservation.actualDateRange (a value yet to be defined) and a formula for the date range between when the question is asked (PerformedObservation.actualDateRange.low) and 2 months prior (PerformedObservation.actualDateRange.low - 2 months).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stratification Criterion Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Foci Date and Time Range
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.:That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Stratification Criterion Observation Reuse Template Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.:That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

Concepts.definition: Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.
An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
